title: Git Remove : Branch
mainDescription: If we need to remove a branch, the command is : <-- git branch -d <branch_name> -->.
A thing to note here if some merges are pending with the master, then git will show an error.
For force deletion use: <-- git branch -D <branch_name> -->.

title: Git Rename : Individual File(s)
mainDescription: To Rename files, just use the mv command followed by <-- git add -A --> command.
Check the example below for clarity.
postDescription: We can see that the once git add -A is done, git actually recognizes it as a renamed file(Clever indeed).

title: Git Rename : Branch
mainDescription: To Rename a branch, use the <-- git branch -m -->.
